alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 11:25AM EDT until April 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Flint River near Griffin... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 12 feet and slowly rising. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 10.9 feet and begin rising again early Saturday morning. It will rise to 11.0 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
